result.execSummary:
The defendant Darin V. Schneider was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $2500 applied to restitution from bond on file as follows:  Pay victim, G.C. in full including restitution surcharge - total of $770.   $635.23 applied to restitution surcharge for victim, Crime Victim's Compensation Fund, and $1094.77 applied to restitution owed to Crime Victim Compenstion Fund.  Remainder of restitution is to be paid Joint and Several with co-defendant Joyce Schneider - 14CF66.
Court costs and the DNA surcharge are paid in full out of bond on file
You shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person with the victim, G.C.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Must comply with any other recommendations of your probation agent.  AMENDED 6-5-15:  Credit for 9 days jail.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darin V. Schneider

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Darin stopped by to get a DNA form-he said his probation agent said he needed this for these two cases; filled out form for him to take over to JASO

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Tremp Cty P&P request copy of document that shows DNA was pd; faxed JOC
To Amend JOC to include jail credit

Defendant appeared with counsel SPD Paul Fredrickson.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  State moves to amend Count 2 in 13CF199 and Count 1 in 14CF64 to misdemeanors and recommended 2 years probation with conditions.  State has complied with victim notification.  Judge reviews charges and potential penalties on both amended counts.  Defendant pleads no contest in 13CF199 to the amended Count 2, Misdemeanor Battery with Domestic Abuse Enhancer; in 14CF64 pleads no contest to amended Count 1, Misdemeanor Battery as PTAC.  Judge reviews plea questionnaire/elements/rights with defendant.  Court makes a finding that a factual basis exists in both cases; accepts pleas; finds waiver of rights and pleas entered freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; finding of guilty on both counts; remaining counts dismissed and read-in.  Court orders sentence withheld and probation 2 years with conditions:  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person with the victim in 14CF64.  Restitution to be paid in 14CF64 and is ordered Joint and Several with co-defendant Joyce Schneider, 14CF66.  Out of the bond on file in 14CF66 $2500 is to be applied to restitution as follows:  Victim to be paid in full including restitution surcharge; balance of $2500 to be paid to the Crime Victim's Compensation Fund and includes the 10% surcharge.  Domestic abuse surcharge is ordered in 13CF199 and costs ordered in both cases.  Court costs to be taken out of bonds on file and balance to be refunded to poster.  Attorney Paul Fredrickson is to determine the amount of jail credit and submit a stipulation to be signed by the Court which will amend the JOC showing the jail credit to be allowed.
AEP clerked.  ADA Inlow and Attorney Fredrickson called Judge Goodman in Monroe County.  Agreement reached.  Plea/sentencing set for 6/5/15 at 8:30 am.
